data.title: Added customizable shortcuts for tile map editor
ConnectionsDock: Double click to create and go to signal connection

Partially deals with #5116 (this PR does not add connection edit on double click)

I didn't find a better way to go to the method, I hope it's not too much of a hack :/

data.title: X11: Can't start the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux/X11, NVIDIA 364.19, Git head: 3b2c96139b39ddcfbadcd21b61e5c1ff608ad95e

**Issue description**
Can't start the editor, but can start a game.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Start the editor or project browser.

Example console output:

``` bash
$ bin/godot.x11.tools.64 -path ../godot-demo-projects-master/2d/platformer -editor
LANG IS en
DPI MODE: 0
X Error of failed request:  BadRequest (invalid request code or no such operation)
  Major opcode of failed request:  140 (RANDR)
  Minor opcode of failed request:  42 ()
  Serial number of failed request:  229
  Current serial number in output stream:  229
$ echo $?
1
```

or

``` bash
$ bin/godot.x11.tools.64
LANG IS en
DPI MODE: 0
X Error of failed request:  BadRequest (invalid request code or no such operation)
  Major opcode of failed request:  140 (RANDR)
  Minor opcode of failed request:  42 ()
  Serial number of failed request:  228
  Current serial number in output stream:  228
$ echo $?
1
```

Compilation command: `$ scons -j 8 platform=x11 target=debug CC='gcc-5' CXX='g++-5' tools=yes`

Tested on GCC 5.4.0 (from AUR) and Clang 3.8.0.

data.title: Added script and shader editor shortcuts
data.body:
Added script and shader editor shortcuts. 

Made the script editor and the shader editor share the same shortcuts, since I believe they should act in the same way, though this can be changed.

data.title: Make .app bundle high resolution aware
data.body:
This commit changes the .app bundle in `tools` to allow running in high resolution (retina) mode.  Tested with the latest Master on 10.11.6.

First pull request, so I hoping I didn't mess it up :)

data.title: BaseButton: Add identifier for shortcut in tooltip
data.body:
This allows to specify a custom place where the shortcut text will be placed in the tooltip. Usage example:

``` C++

select_button->set_shortcut(ED_SHORTCUT("canvas_item_editor/tool_select",TTR("Select Mode (Q)"),KEY_Q));
select_button->set_tooltip(TTR("Select Mode $sc")+"\n... some other text ...");
```

Results in:

```
Select Mode (Q)
... some other text ...
```

If the tooltip does not contain the text `$sc`, then the shortcut text will be added at the end of the tooltip like normal.

data.title: FindReplaceBar: Fix search bug when text is selected
data.body: Fixes #5136

data.title: Support shadows with DynamicFonts
data.body:
Currently, DynamicFonts can't cast any shadows, not even sharp ones. It would be nice if they could be set to cast a sharp shadow at least, with customizable X/Y offset and color.

Something like this (from another engine): ![shot0001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/180032/15986801/83915e9e-3012-11e6-9e42-50f22093db80.jpg)

data.title: ERROR: initialize: Condition ' modifiers == __null ' is true.
data.body:
My OS:

```
4.4.0-24-generic #43-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jun 8 19:27:37 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
Release:    16.04
Codename:   xenial
```

This is using Godot Stable 2.0.3-stable x11 64-bit version. When I attempt to run Godot nothing happens. When running from the command line I get the following output:

```
ERROR: initialize: Condition ' modifiers == __null ' is true.
   At: platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:117.
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

I know that my computer supports OpenGL and as far as I know I have the latest drivers.

```
david@david-X200CA:~$ glxinfo | grep -i opengl
OpenGL vendor string: Intel Open Source Technology Center
OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI Intel(R) Ivybridge Mobile 
OpenGL core profile version string: 3.3 (Core Profile) Mesa 11.2.0
OpenGL core profile shading language version string: 3.30
OpenGL core profile context flags: (none)
OpenGL core profile profile mask: core profile
OpenGL core profile extensions:
OpenGL version string: 3.0 Mesa 11.2.0
OpenGL shading language version string: 1.30
OpenGL context flags: (none)
OpenGL extensions:
OpenGL ES profile version string: OpenGL ES 3.0 Mesa 11.2.0
OpenGL ES profile shading language version string: OpenGL ES GLSL ES 3.00
OpenGL ES profile extensions:
```

This is frustrating because previously this version worked just fine. I updated my computer and now it do longer works. It seems to be something related to x11

data.title: GUI: Discussion
data.body: Game GUI is very different from that offered Godot. Your built-in GUI comfortable doing editor but it does not play. And that would make even a simple game to do their own controls that is tiring. It may be worth considering the creation of a small number of standard control for the casual games. Examples of successful implementation of such control can be viewed in the Unity3D or CocosCreator.

data.title: Improved Blender/Collada extra section handling, can break double sid…
data.body:
…ed backwards compability

I think that the <extra> element handling in Blender/Collada effect export can be created only when needed. This is when material has normal map, is unshaded or is double sided (or any combination of these).
Before <extra> element was created always. Typically it had empty FCOLLADA element and GOOGLEEARTH double_sided set to 0.
As I changed the default value for double sidedness to FALSE it can collide with other exporters which maybe assume that this feature is normally set to TRUE.
Still I think it's better assumption in game engine that material is one sided and it should be extra stated that it is double sided.

data.title: OS.get_system_time_secs() result is not in seconds
data.body:
Tested on Windows 10 with Godot 2.0.3

If I try to print the result of `OS.get_system_time_secs()` every frame, I get this result:

```
Time = -1182457248
Time = -1182287248
Time = -1182117248
Time = -1181947248
Time = -1181777248
Time = -1181617248
Time = -1181447248
Time = -1181297248
Time = -1181127248
Time = -1180957248
Time = -1180787248
...
```

Which is not in seconds, because it increases by thousands per frame.

The method is also undocumented, so maybe the function has the wrong name, or is obsolete?

Edit: I see there was a closed issue about this: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3143
However, this function is supposed to have been removed?

data.title: HTTPClient SSL does not work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows V2.03.stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
HTTPClient will crash if SSL is used

**Steps to reproduce:**
var http = HTTPClient.new()
http.connect("google.com,16325,true,true) 
while( http.get_status()==HTTPClient.STATUS_CONNECTING or http.get_status()==HTTPClient.STATUS_RESOLVING):
        http.poll()

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

*\* Solution I used to fix it ***
Version: Windows V2.1.alpha
Uncomment line 319 of SConstruct (I think it needs more work then this which is why I am not pushing it in a git push.) and then compile

data.title: Collapsible sections in the inspector.
data.body:
I found to be quite tiring to scroll up and down the inspector for a single node to add keyframes.

I was using Godot as a motion graphics presentation tool, and it worked quite well, but I almost ruined my mouse wheel after so much scrolling between the transform section and the material controls. If we have the chance to collapse those sections that are not being used frequently, animating inside Godot would be so much better.

It would probably be best if it is permanent across all nodes in the scene. Or maybe across nodes of the same type. The behaviour can also be changed in the engine configuration window.

data.body:

If this should not be changed ( because  one of the sprites must be named default ), you'd better don't let the user the possibily of change the name of the sprite.

data.title: TimeSeek node in AnimationTreePlayer now propagates filters
Add Array.find(what, from) and Array.rfind(what, from)
data.body:
Add a possibility to add a start search index in `Array.find()`. Also adds a `rfind` function to search backwards in the array (this mimics the `String.rfind()` function).

Closes #5020.

data.title: Localisation issue with texture atlas generated at export time
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Godot 2.1 Master, Gentoo Linux

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): When you put in an atlas 2 sprites including one that is beeing remapped by the local options and an original one the original may load fine(on one projects I had it load the remapped file but too lazy to really reproduce that) while the remapped one will crash Godot:

> ERROR OPENING FILE: res://icon_remap.png
> ERROR: load: Failed loading image: res://icon_remap.png
>    At: scene/io/resource_format_image.cpp:118.
> ERROR: load: Failed loading resource: res://icon_in.png
>    At: core/io/resource_loader.cpp:218.
> ERROR: poll: Can't load dependency: res://icon_in.png

**Steps to reproduce:** Just export using the given project then run with:
-lang fr (for exemple) and then
-lang en

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[test_atlas_local.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/309709/test_atlas_local.tar.gz)

data.title: GDScript: get_properties_list() returns unexpected results
data.body:
At some point in my game, I need to iterate the members of a class in order to serialize it (althought other purposes exist), but I didn't found any way to do it, but to use dictionnaries instead.

There is a `get_method_list()` function, which return alls methods, fine. But there is also a `get_property_list()` function, which returns unexpected results that have nothing to do with actual members (see this QA thread: http://www.godotengine.org/qa/5097/how-to-iterate-the-members-of-a-class).

Can we have support for members iteration in GDScript?

Note: there is an open issue about reflection (#4372), but the discussion was off-topic so I wasn't sure about posting in it.

data.title: Drag&Drop nodes from scene tree dock into script editor
data.body:
This would be a huge time saver if implemented right. 
Admit it, the most annoying part is to find nodes by their names from script, especially when scene tree is huge, and when you're moving around nodes and constantly changing layout. Current solution is node groups that are hard to keep track of, but I think there is a better way.

I'm suggesting the ability to drag and drop nodes into script  (or right click inside script editor) , but it can be split into three main problems:
- basically inserting get_node("") statement into the code and filling in node path automatically.
- making scripteditorplugin change all of them whenever a node is being moved or removed.
- for convenience get_node("") statement that is recognized can be replaced with a button (inside of script editor of course), inside of which are node icon and node name. Pressing on it would select that particular node.

I would implement this feature myself but still figuring out how drag&drop was implemented across the editor.

data.title: Feature: Option for TextureFrame to keep aspect ratio when expanding
data.body:
TextureFrame can be stretched (expanded), but it is not always desired. Would be great if it could have another stretch mode that would also preserve it's original aspect ratio. 

A new node with equal functionality can also be an option, for example if HBoxContainer has cells that are 2x3 in size, if that node is inside it gets shrinked down to 2x2 and centered. (more like it's children become shrinked)

Something in this direction (just a quick implementation out of CenterContainer)
![fixed_container](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6633998/15974735/53776096-2f4a-11e6-8adc-241ee53a1f02.gif)

data.title: Sync Spanish translations from weblate
data.body:
The Spanish translation files in this repo are not up to date with the ones in weblate. 

Some users are testing the latest builds and using them to translate the documentation but they've found some texts are wrong or out of place. This doesn't happen if I build using the latest files from weblate.

data.title: Control viewport doesn't get cropped when inside scroll container
data.body: What happens is that when a control node with viewport is inside a scroll container - it never gets cropped. Test scene: http://blenderstars.com/uploads/tmp/viewport_bug.zip

data.title: Control Viewport resets position when stretched
data.body: Basically when "stretch_mode" is set to "viewport" in project settings, all controls that have viewport as a child reset their position to top left corner of the screen and never move. You can try with this test scene http://blenderstars.com/uploads/tmp/viewport_bug.zip, just go to project settings and change stretch mode, the cube will always be floating when scrolling.
